metadata.title: USN-6783-1 -- VLC vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that VLC incorrectly handled certain media files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause VLC to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or potential arbitrary code execution.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6783-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-l10n - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 libvlc-dev - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 libvlccore9 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 libvlc-bin - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-data - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 libvlc5 - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-bin - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 libvlccore-dev - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.16-1ubuntu0.1~esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
